hints_html:
Note \(3^{2n-1} = \frac{9^n}{3}.\)

Use the formula for the sum of a geometric series.
hints_latex: Use the formula for the sum of a geometric series.
hints_raw:
Note <math> 
3^{2n-1} = \frac{9^n}{3}. 
</math>
Use the formula for the sum of a geometric series.
question: 1 (f)
sols_html:
The series can be rewritten as

\(\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{7 \cdot 3^{2n-1}}{10^n} = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{7}{3} \cdot \left( \frac{9}{10} \right)^n.\)

This is a geometric series with common ratio \(r = 9/10 < 1.\), so it converges. Recall that a convergent geometric series has sum

\(\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} ar^n = \frac{a}{1-r}.\)

Note that to use this formula we need to adjust the series to start at \(n=0.\) We get

\(\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{7 \cdot 3^{2n-1}}{10^n} = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{7}{3} \cdot \left( \frac{9}{10} \right)^n = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{7}{3} \cdot \frac{9}{10} \left( \frac{9}{10} \right)^n = \frac{7}{3} \cdot \frac{9}{10} \cdot \frac{1}{1-\frac{9}{10}} = \frac{7}{3} \cdot \frac{9}{10} \cdot \frac{1}{\frac{1}{10}} = \frac{7}{3} \cdot 9 = 21.\)
